flawed_nl_solution:
Twice the number of participants in 2018 is 150 participants x 2 = <<150*2=300>>300 participants.
The number of participants in 2019 was 300 participants + 20 participants = <<300+20=350>>350 participants.
Half the number of participants in 2019 is 350 participants /2 = <<350/2=175>>175 participants.
The number of participants in 2020 was 175 participants - 40 participants = <<175-40=135>>135 participants.
There were 350 participants - 135 participants = <<350-135=215>>215 more participants in 2019 than in 2020.
#### 215

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 320, not 350. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
